snippet: The European Parliament, in a move favored by users and producers of electronic cigarettes, voted against regulating the products as medical devices.
abstract: European Parliament scraps proposals by health officials that electronic cigarettes be tightly regulated as medical devices, setting stage for debate in United States over extent of regulation; European lawmakers endorse permissive approach to sale and use of e-cigarettes.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and MATT RICHTEL
byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Strasbourg, France, and Matt Richtel from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The European Parliament, in a move favored by users and producers of electronic cigarettes, voted against regulating the products as medical devices.

headline.main: European Lawmakers Reject Tight Restrictions on E-Cigarettes
headline.print_headline: European Lawmakers Reject Tight Restrictions on E-Cigarettes
